title: Oscars 2017: Iranian film The Salesman wins the Best Film in Foreign Language : Hollywood, News - India Today
text:
The Salesman 
Iranian film The Salesman has bagged the Best Film in Foreign Language at 89th Academy Awards. 
Directed by Asghar Farhadi, The Salesman tells the story of a young couple who plays the lead roles in a local theater's presentation of Arthur Miller's Death of a Salesman. 
CATCH ALL THE LIVE UPDATES ON OSCARS 2017 
Director Asghar decided to boycott the awards after American President's ban on Iranian people from entering America. 
In the acceptance speech made on his behalf, he said, "My absence is out of the respect for the people of my country and other six countries." 
The film was pitted against Land of Mine (Denmark), A Man Called Ove (Sweden), Tanna (Australia), Toni Erdmann (German) in the category.
